history.content:
For at least Math 113, your goal shouldn't just be to get into it. Every semester there are great, ok, and honestly quite bad professors. If your goal is to just get into Math 113, you can adjustment period it, but your goal should be to Phase I it with a good professor so you can have a great time, learn a lot, and actually enjoy the class and learn abstract algebra.

The other class I would phase I is Stat 140, as it is very popular. 

I think CS61B will take everyone who signs up for it like it did in the past, so I wouldn't phase I it. 

I am not familiar with BIOENG 100, I would compare it to DATA 100 on berkeleytime.com to see which one fills up faster to figure out which to phase I.

Here's my unsolicited advice: 

Bioeng 100 seems like more a breadth than a tech, with that in mind 4 techs is a very demanding course load. Make sure you have a class to drop if it gets too demanding for you. For myself I notice I can float by with 4 techs, but then I am more jumping from deadline to deadline instead of really taking in the content. 

If I had more free time, I would try to knock the CS61B projects out of the park, and do cool extra things to them after finishing early, discussing ideas with Professor Hug, etc. 

For Data 100 similarly as above and I would try to win the Kaggle competitions with free time and make an awesome end of semester project.


For Math 113 and Stat 140 I would dive deeper into the material and go to OH.

Also maybe you can get involved with teaching or research on campus which imo is also super enriching if you only have 3 techs instead of 4.

Good luck next semester Jerry!

tldr: easier to excel in less classes

children.subject: Thanks!!! I really appreciate your detailed answer!!! Since spring 2020 is still remote instruction mode, I plan to take more courses so that I can save time to involve in research and clubs when being back to campus in my sophomore year. I don't know if it sounds a decent plan cuz I felt I can concentrate more on my courses when locked at home with nothing else to do.
You're (99%) not going to get into BioE 100 with that enrolment time, just as an fyi

history.content:
Next semester, I'm going to take MATH 113 + CS 61B + DATA 100 + STAT 140 + BIOENG 100.

Which classes I should put for Phase I and Phase II? My enrollment is really really late: Oct. 28th 10 am. 

Is there a way to maximize my chance of getting into all 5 courses above?
history.subject: Spring 2020 enrollment
